Reviews.Title: “The worst ever experience...and still going through it”
Reviews.Author: Nikhil V
Reviews.Content: Citymax hotel, Bur Dubai isnt the ideal hotel for me personally, but due to my relationship with certain someone I know from landmark group I am living their since the past few months. I must say as the days have progressed, it's become from bad to worse. Where should I start from? Let's start from the very beginning, the rooms are small but are not that bad for a single person. However, one must really be careful while walking in the rooms, more often than not you will bang your feet against the furniture for sure, happened to me countless number of times, specially when you wake up in the morning and moving towards the bathroom! Funny but true. So be careful The breakfast! Oh god, this is truly bizarre, more than 600-700 people in an area with maximum of 100-150 seating, felt like fox river (refer to prison break). So many times it has happened to me when I (after a struggle, eventually find a place to sit) and after eating I go for a refill, by the time I come back someone else has taken my table and usually ends up in an unnecessary argument. My point is why is the breakfast done in an area which can hold a max of 100-200 people, when at full occupancy the hotel can be occupied by more than 1000+ people. Absurd is the right word to use. Then we move to the receptionists, poor guests who have to face receptionists having such huge egos, who don't even know the meaning of S in service, one name that I remember is of a lady called daisy. I am sure everyone has certain issues in life, but at work they should never surface and specially not towards the customers. Well, I was unlucky as I am sure this was the reason for an argument with her, totally uncalled for, when she actually called me ( cant recall the name, which was her husbands!!) by her husbands name, which I later asked her about. And I had gone to her asking for a change of 200 dirhams, ideally 2 fiftys and a 100 note. Well the response I got was an egoistic and arrogant one. "Sir, we are sorry but we can't give out change at all (followed by her husbands name) in the most arrogant and haughty manner, first she said its not allowed (even palm jumeirah staff doesn't have the guts to say that to the customer) pathetic, then she said, I don't have and eventually I had to speak to the manager in charge to get some change. This is just one of the many instances I had trouble with the receptionists. The fundamental problem with hotels like citymax hotel bur Dubai is the fact that they think that the people living in the hotel are cheap, uneducated and just living on the edge as far as they are concerned. They show the least respect to customers, their service is as poor as any cheap 1 star hotel back in India. The only way to improve things is to give proper training to their staff and make them respect the customers, greet them warmly and genuinely help their guests. Now, coming to the biggest disappointment of my stay (which is still in progress btw) is "huddles sports bar". What is so funny about the name is that they actually call it a sports bar without evening understanding what a sports bar means. Sports bars are meant to have multiple screens showing variety of sports or maybe the major sporting events WITH COMMENTARY of course. But here, oh god, there is juke machine and a live band playing while an intense match between United and Chelsea is going on, India and Pakistan is going on etc...just pointless. I mean how can someone overlook such important factors. When I asked the manager whose from Kashmir, India (can't recall the name as I don't care) he responds in the most inappropriate manner and says to me if I have any concerns I should not talk to him, but the marketing team of citymax. What an idiotic response, i shall never forget it, this is the level of their so called managers, instead of noting it as a suggestion they ask us to go to the marketing team of the sports bar and urge them to put some commentary. This portrays his attitude towards his work and his respect and understanding of the company values ( if any). I just want to end this long review by saying that if this is how they treat their guests, it's disgusting to say the least, I feel angry and I don't understand why customer service isn't in their agenda at all. I can understand its a budget hotel but come on there has to be a line drawn beyond which they cannot afford to fall. They must properly train their staff, bloody manners are the bare minimum. But amongst the ill mannered staff there are genuinely nice and cheerful people, like Mr. Balouch and Mr. Khan, they are the duty managers if I am not mistaken, however, their subordinates are just their opposites. Certain room service staff is also nice and friendly, as well as the cleaners. But the overall experience has been a forgetful one... I strongly disrecommend this hotel if you are looking for average service also. Still stuck here in what I presume is the 100 star hotel (as per their outlook) which in all fairness is less than a 2 star hotel. Nikhil

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: Curtis W
Reviews.Content: I hate all the whiners in life,of course this is not the Ritz but I did not have to pay 750 us a night either. The staff is extremely attentive and the grounds are clean and property well maintained. This is my third stay and I don't even think of staying anywhere else while in Dubai. Very good restraunts on site a great sports bar with all the fun you can ask for. Shuttle to the beach,roof top pool with awesome bar and views. I look forward to my trips into this region and will continue my loyalty to this brand

Reviews.Title: “Not worthed”
Reviews.Author: Zulk
Reviews.Content: I booked online after seeing the pictures on the web. To my surprise, the hotel was just not to my expectation. The rooms are small, beds are way too small. We had to carry our own luggages to the room. I will never stay at this hotel again. The only good thing were the staff, there were quite friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Good value fro money”
Reviews.Author: Nada_K_R
Reviews.Content: Good 3* hotel, fulfilled our expectations. Rooms are indeed on smaller side however big enough for comfortable stay. Nobody comes here to stay whole day in the hotel room. Breakfast is ok, would prefer more choices but it is actually good variety and quality for a 3* hotel. Staff is friendly, room was cleaned regularly. Internet is free (cable) which I appreciated very much. Location is good, we easily reached all points of interest. Hotel also offers a shuttle bus to the beach. I would recommend this hotel to tourists looking for reasonably priced hotels, offering reasonable level of service and good location.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay, new property, good amenities and generally attentive service”
Reviews.Author: DS8888
Reviews.Content: Keeping in mind this is not a five star, it is a wonderful value in the heart of Dubai. Also keep in mind that it is geared to tourists and not a business hotel. So, expectations have to be in line. I stayed here for almost a month in January (7th floor). Did not have time to write earlier. The manager (not the one responding here) will recognize me. He, among others, was unfailingly responsive. Overall, the room is clean and comfortable - slightly smaller rooms but this is not a resort, so fine. Yes, the engineering guys are clueless and in a hurry to get the job done. But in the end, the accommodations matched up with good 3 or 4 star places. It is a new property and is being kept well. Breakfast is fine. Earlier complaints I had read did not hold true. Always a bit of variation and catered to Western and Asian tastes. The gym is airy, adequate and clean. The pool seemed fine - did not use it. (I did inform (not complain) the manager that the staff at breakfast were surprisingly sullen, and not welcoming at the entry podium - not a cool thing early in the morning. That was the one aspect that never quite improved.) Very convenient - can reach all parts of Dubai efficiently. Great grocery options - Spinneys for example - within a 10 minute walk. Plenty of passable restaurants near by. Airport 15 minutes away. Overall, highly recommended for a nice 3 1/2 star stay.

Reviews.Title: “birthdaytrip to Dubai with husband and two teens”
Reviews.Author: Inccu
Reviews.Content: We were not expecting any luxury, just a commodation for a weeks holiday. The concierge was very friendly and gave us two rooms near to each other, as we had requested. The location on 7th floor was good, though, one room 707 had a great view and the other 704 none at all (the window facing other hotelwindows and very dark). Otherwise the rooms are all the same and very ok, the bathroom even had a toiletshower. The beds are fine and we got (when requested) individual blankets in the masterbed and extra pillows. Brakfast was ok, but often fruit and youghurt was finished (beacuse of some who took a whole plate full of one item). The biggest problem was the huge (approx 90%) amount of russians, they pollute the poolwater when they do not get a shower before swimming at any time. We even saw some who was actually washing themself in the pool (after a sweaty day on town?), disgusting. So please Citymax, make BIG signs for the russians and make the poolboy check they are followed. Otherwise the poolboy was very helpful and the poolarea ok, though it could be bigger with more chairs. The hotel rents towels and mats for the beach very cheap and the hotelbus to the free beach is free (you can rent chairs AED15 and umbrellasAED5 at the beach). Overall we were satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vaue for Money”
Reviews.Author: rath_ashish
Reviews.Content: As always, stayed here on 2 March, 2012 for one night. The hotel is excellent value for money. Clean rooms ( on the smaller side), good internet (complimentary) etc. The location is excellent and there is a small super market next door. The breakfast tends to get crowded due to tour groups staying and is passable. The food choices are good. Check in and Check out is fast and this is the place to stay if you are looking for Value for money in Dubai hotels!

Reviews.Title: “Citymax Bur Dubai”
Reviews.Author: Joanne1234567
Reviews.Content: Great value for the money. Clean, efficient and courtious staff. Not beach front, not near malls, etc but affordable, clean and left you with money to spend seeing the sights. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your money staying in this hotel”
Reviews.Author: samaracity2011
Reviews.Content: Food is awful. Just impossible to eat. Every day the same menu. Staff is unfriendly. Rooms are not cleaned the way they are supposed to. Housekeeper asked us several times to give him tips. Rooms are noisy.Strongly not recommended to stay in this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Week end at Citymax Dubai”
Reviews.Author: josecpaul
Reviews.Content: I spent two days & one night . Found it worth for each penny. economical . Helping Staff . Good ambiance . was on a business trip , so didnt get much time to check other facilities.

Reviews.Title: “So noisy and clumzy”
Reviews.Author: akipierrot
Reviews.Content: The hotel room was small and noisy. The cause of noise was that the hotel room I stayed was facing to the wide road and the window lock was loose and I could not close it tightly. I asked the front to send someone to fix it. He fixed it(only tightened the screw, but due to widened screw hole, it was not enough tightened.) but as we sitll had the space between the wall and the window, the noise had came into the room. The closet was so small that I was not able to hang all my clothes. On the mini-bar table, I found many ants which got into my cap. The air-conditioner controller was not fanctioned well. For your refence, I stayed at the room No.667.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in small room”
Reviews.Author: Matrixvish
Reviews.Content: Was there in 3rd week of Jan. To attend health conference. The place is very clean, smells fresh, rooms well equipped, but small for 2 people. Room was cleaned everyday. Breakfast was ok. Russian tourists all over, Russian menu all over the place. No tension of loud music, very quite place. Kamat hotel a few meters down the road. Hotel arranges for free shuttle to important places. Only wired Internet free in the room. In lobby, 20 AED per hour. All tourist related info available at the desk. They take payment on arrival.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth for the money”
Reviews.Author: Vijaymenon
Reviews.Content: small rooms and I found like cheating the customer

Reviews.Title: “Nice and clean 3 star property but with small rooms.”
Reviews.Author: SaurabhNayar
Reviews.Content: I selected Citymax Bur Dubai based on reviews at Tripadvisor and I do not regret this decision. I stayed here for 7 nights, first two nights were not that comfortable as their was some noise from the Restaurant & bar located on the ground floor. We requested to change the room on the first night itself but were told that hotel is fully booked and they cannot fulfill our request. But after some more talk with the manager we got the room on the 7th floor facing the Standard Chartered Bank, which in-turn was quite comfortable than the 2nd floor. The rooms are quite clean but are quite small in size, the beds were quite comfortable but again the bathroom size was small. One thing different on 7th floor rooms was the bath tub availability in the bathroom which was not their on 2nd. The room is equipped with a 32" LCD which shows just a few English and Hindi channels, a small refrigerator, tea and coffee refreshments. The top floor of the hotel (8th floor) has small pool which can be used from 6 AM till the evening. Coming to the breakfast buffet (inclusive in room rent), the menu consist of regular continental food while including a single Indian dish. We did find the food of a good quality and the service of restaurant staff to be quick. But since the hotel was mostly occupied we did had to search and even wait for table to be free, but can't entirely blame the hotel for this as fully booked hotel during DSF time will have its consequences. For people looking for Indian food, the hotel is ideally located at a walkable distance near Kamat (Veg) / Gazebo (Non veg) restaurants, to locate these restaurants after exiting Citymax hotel turn right and cross the traffic signal, head straight and u will find them on your right. Also, if you take right from the above mentioned traffic signal you will find Mc Donalds, Pizza Hut in few meters. For outdoor, the hotel is located near the area Bur Dubai creek area and the Meena Bazaar, the walk to these will take approx 20 mins, creek area is good for stroll in the evening while featuring the DSF celebrations. Also one can take Abra (boat) from the creek for a visit to Diera which has the famous Gold Souk. For visit to other parts of Dubai one can take taxi (which can be expensive) from outside hotel or can walk to Al Karma metro station which is at 15-20 mins walk able distance.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel With poor food!!”
Reviews.Author: Tatanasov
Reviews.Content: The worst breakfast I ever eat,every day is the same,no variety of food.No wifi internet,if you like to use they charge 20 dhm per hour,if you want to make a phone call in dubai city charge you 5 dhms with no to give you any receipts!!! Rooms are small but kindly clean!!

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant hotel at very competitively priced”
Reviews.Author: 1businesstraveller
Reviews.Content: I needed a hotel for one night and booked through Booking.com. Arrived just after noon and was allowed to check-in immediately as their policy is check-in after 14:00hrs, so was pleasantly surprised that they had a room available at that time. The hotel has some 700 rooms and had a very high occupancy, mostly full of families and young couples. The hotel is currently one of the most competitively priced 3 star hotels available in Dubai and just a 10 minute walk from the Metro system and taxis are frequently passing by, so transportation is easy from that location. The bedroom was small'ish, but perfectly agreeable and very quiet as the hotel was very full at the time that I stayed as Dubai was in the midst of its month-long Shopping Fair, a large Medical exhibition, The England - Pakistan Cricket tests and also a large Golf Tournament, so the pricing was extremely good for the time of year.

Reviews.Title: “Save your money for shopping”
Reviews.Author: Mitch12344
Reviews.Content: I was very apprehensive about staying at a 3 star as honestly I truly prefer 4 or 5 as often three stars outside the US look more like 1 or 2. If you want a clean room, nice shower and just a good place to sleep then this Will suit you well. Nice sports bar for a night cap. Service is friendly, but not as experienced or knowledgeable as higher rated concierge. Make sure you already have your tours and restaurants per-booked. I paid $85US per night during a convention period where I have often paid +$300 for a nice 5 star. When I look back I realize that when I am in Dubai to work I never really get to enjoy the extra amenities. Their is a small, but useful gym and even a pool. Virtually all rooms are the same size. No views. Would be nice if they did offer larger rooms. I think most will be pleased if you go to the hotel with fair expectations. I was pleased and I can be a bit of a hotel snob. Good shower (bring your own shampoo as the soaps provided are very average), nice bed and reasonably quiet. Don't stay near a lift.

Reviews.Title: “Good for nothing”
Reviews.Author: DAG_12
Reviews.Content: I was a frequent user of the hotle on bussiness trip. I never saw a nice hotel with inconsistent reception and sales managers to get more money from you based on booking issue. Very bad...... good for nothing !! If you want to dissorganize your day/stay in dubai stay at citmax burdubai !! I am changing a hotel after the receptionist keep me infron of his desk for 1 hr when I reached the hotel at around 2.30am after midnight. Then they denied my booking and told me will help me with 60+ % price increase from the rate. Now I am checking out to another hotel thanks to dubai there are so many nice hotels. !!

Reviews.Title: “Good, but don't try and change your booking details!”
Reviews.Author: Keelix
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Citymax, Bur Dubai on several occasions whilst travelling on business. The hotel is clean, the rooms adequate and the food in the various restaurants and bars is generally very good. I am very happy with the standard of the hotel for the relatively low price of the rooms. I would however caution those that might have to change their check out day during their stay! During my last two stays, my party has had to amend the length of our stay (some going early, others staying longer) and it seems that the reception is unable to deal with this complex issue! On both occasions, they claimed that they didn't know that rooms had been vacated early and those that stay longer have their rooms keys invalidated, phone calls from reception and knocks on the door, all because the staff thought we were checking out! On both occasions, I have spoken to reception myself, as well as stood at the desk whilst my company spoke to staff on the phone. Unfortunately, that doesn't ensure that our bookings are actually changed and the information passed on to those that need it! A very good, clean and comfortable hotel for the price. Just don't try and change your booking mid stay!

Reviews.Title: “Good facility for Honeymooners & Leisure tourists, Just Ok for Business Travellers”
Reviews.Author: Shrinivas n
Reviews.Content: In the Hotel city Max, some of the rooms offer a splendid view of Burj Khalifa. The rooms which are in the smoking zone are especially nice on that front. Rooms are also very clean and new. The hotel is new and it shows in rooms too. Fortunately we found the rooms there to have a small refrigerator with some stocked items and a small safe (locker) too where we could keep our valuable belongings, not that we had any. All the rooms were fitted with a high speed wired internet connection (not wifi) which works well. And almost all rooms are basically the same in size so there is nothing much to choose from. Most Indian travelers book it because of its cheaper 3 star rates.In India , Antilog Vacations is the official partner of most Dubai hotels & offers cheaper and better services. We went thru them as they gave us an assured service & low cost package. There was a long queue of tourists at the check in counter and hence it took a long time to process. May be in peak season they should consider better handling of this process. The location of the hotel is neither the best nor bad either. It is slightly further from the metro station (10 min by a cab, and cabs are really cheap in that area) and bus stop. There are some good quality restaurants in the vicinity. International popular and reasonable names like McDonalds and Subway are also there. And one drawback of this hotel is that they don’t allow any outside food inside the hotel. They claim it’s for our own good but I don’t see how? It is practically forcing us to eat their high priced items. And speaking of food, well their breakfast is not to be cherished at all. My suggestion is to try the nearby restaurants since breakfast has few limited items often not refilled. There is a very nice pub and restaurants are suited to Indian tastes. A nice dance floor on the bottom too for those who want to sweat off the evenings. Another special attraction is the swimming pool on the rooftop and looks really nice. Gym also exists with all the required equipments. Well I guess it is average for business tourists but a good option fr honeymooners

Reviews.Title: “stay only if u have own vehicle or willing to shell out for cabs..”
Reviews.Author: nickydouala
Reviews.Content: we stayed in this hotel for 1 day & found it to be really good..amenities were excellent, the hotel itself was clean..rooms were small but nicely made..it had coffee maker with essentials & bathrooms were ok ; the swimming pool was good too....but the access to other major points in the city were a lot to be desired for..public transport was hard to find for major bus stops like gold souk in deira..& although it mentions 1km from dubai museum,,,it is a very tiresome walk if u do indeed..& if u r in a hurry to reach the hotel..like i was ..u should be lucky to find a cab..if u cannot walk the distance..there is a night club at the foot of the hotel..so u should be willing to sleep in loud music if u've come tired from the city after a long hard day.. all in all the hotel is value for money .....see the subject line...

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: RihabMysaraHassan
Reviews.Content: Stayes for one night, was really nice and calm the hotel is very high service standards. Very clean, newly furnished rooms, very close to city center. They have Buffet Restaurant, Indian Restaurant, Chinese Restaurant,Buffet Restaurant, Indian Restaurant, Chinese Restaurant, and Discooooooooo. ;)

Reviews.Title: “Ridiculous”
Reviews.Author: j4r3d54
Reviews.Content: This place is mostly clean, and thats the only thing i can say is good about this place, they dont let you place calls to food places that deliver because they try to force you to eat their food at their prices, they wouldn't eve let me get change for the vending machines because it cost 3aed for a soda and they wanted me to buy theirs for 10aed at the cafe. The room is also literally smaller than my dorm in college as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great value & location”
Reviews.Author: Gorgeous1962
Reviews.Content: Just stayed on a 3 night stop over in Dubai and was well impressed with the Citymax chain of hotels almost like a Travelodge but comfort as good as a Premier Inn. Both rooms offered to our party were clean, tidy & for the price had good facilties having booked thru Octupus Hotels in the UK the overall experience was very good. The bars & restaurants on offer were of good standard and the night we ate at the Sizzling Wok we had the Food & Beverage option for 111 Dirhams amost ( 20.00 Pounds ) and was very impressed with the food and selection of drinks included from 8pm to 11pm and staff were very attentive in all areas. Lastly we spoke to a member of staff called Leizel Cabillo-Montano who was checking on hotel guests wether they were happy or had any feedback which was gr8 as we noticed that the high floor pool area lacked sunbeds and that maybe the feedback we gave her may help future guests staying at the Citymax Bur Dubai. Overall this hotel offers gr8 price, comfort & staff and anybody staying or lookin for a budget or good situated accomodation should consider this property first..We will return and lastly thank Leizel for her time to listen to us and may her career with Citymax move forward as she showed us as guests that we are important for the hotel to make changes & move forward.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ShahbaazMithani
Reviews.Content: I went to Dubai with family for vacation. It was nice staying at this hotel. Good location in Bur Dubai. Its economical. Easy to find transportation. Staff is very courteous, helpful and cooperative. Clean rooms. There is a store nearby for all daily need items. Definitely would go again.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent value for money”
Reviews.Author: Sander J
Reviews.Content: The room is spacious enough, and was cleaned every day. I especially liked the refrigerator in the room. Also the desk in the room turned out to be very handy when working on a laptop. Also the free parking in the underground parking garage was great. Didn't use the breakfast option. The dinner-buffet however was very good. Good choice, and only 49 Dirhams. The Metro station is a 10 minute walk, and there is a supermarket just about the corner. A taxi takes you to and from the airport within 15 minutes. There are however a few cons about the room: - The bathroom gets very wet when taking a shower. - Although the free WIRED internet connection worked fine, I do prefer a WiFi connection.

Reviews.Title: “good no thrills hotel closeby to the airport for biz traveler or lowcost tourist”
Reviews.Author: Kortenbergtraveler
Reviews.Content: if you have to be early at the airport or fly in late, this place is only a maximum 10 euro taxi ride of the airport. The price is never above usd 100 a night. it is like a Novotel, but without that brand, meaning clean, no thrills, modernly designed, good quality 3 star. A nice pub downstairs, possibility to eat for 49 dirhams only at night at the buffet (no high quality, just enough, same as breakfast by the way). But you need a taxi to get somewhere because there is nothing to do in the area, except for a .... supermarket. One negative point : Russian low budget tourists have discovered this hotel as well.

Reviews.Title: “Good Budget Hotel Near Karama Metro Station...”
Reviews.Author: Qutub
Reviews.Content: It was a business trip I went to Dubai, and the reason to stay here was it is near the place I was having work. The hotel is OK. The breakfast was not good at all. Eating 2-3 item in the menu. The staff was helpfull and co-operative. Easy excess to internet for free from the room and reasonlay charged in the lobby. The good part is that it is little bit away from the central dur dubai rush of Mena bazar. Nice place to stay for short visit and good reasonable rates.

Reviews.Title: “Good Budget Hotel... could be better..”
Reviews.Author: thelostsoul
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Citymax between 13-17 dec during my holiday trip to Dubai. In overall its a good hotel at a decent location which is close to metro and shopping areas like burjuman and meena bazaar close by.. However, i had a bad experience as far as the breakfast goes. Absolutly no choices. a little more variety would be really good..

Reviews.Title: “Nice experience”
Reviews.Author: VarunPrakash5
Reviews.Content: The hotel has nice restaurants, good food, friendly staff and very functional living space! It seems that great thought has been put while setting up this place. The process of making a room reservation is very simple & straight. Overall, its great value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money, no frills hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ian F
Reviews.Content: As a low budget hotel it scores over the Ibis which I think is catering for the same market share in that the Citymax rooms have a bar fridge. In both cases the rooms are small and spartan. This is to be expected. The breakfast was uninspiring. Very little choice and not very appealing. Probably better for the Middle Eastern clientele. Mind you, the guests were from all over the place, with not many Mid Eastern people among them when I was there. A little more variety in the breakfast would be an advantage and serving real coffee, not Nescafe would go down well. Be aware that if you ask for a late check out that the card key for the door will be cancelled after 12:30 (or even earlier). I had to go down to reception to get back into the room and the line took too long to get sorted, at least 20 minutes. Apart from that, the room was clean, the staff courteous though I personally prefer real soap in the bathroom than the liquid, this is obviously a company policy and I took it at face value. No actual problems there. The bathroom did collect water though. A good hotel to sleep in if you are busy rushing around Dubai. The location is good. Not far from the Metro and the BurJurman centre. With taxis charging a minimum 10Dhs you can get to the metro without any problems and then onto the rest of Dubai. Close to virtually everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Very Okay”
Reviews.Author: oroque
Reviews.Content: This hotel is good value for a low budget trip. my room was just above 100USD per night and it had all the basics and a nice decor. Also, the complimentary coffee and water set was welcome. smiling staff also a plus. rooftop swimming pool was not so bad either and they have an amazing gym. however, thats where it ends. for a bed and breakfast booking i was constantly asked to pay for my breakfast (twice by the same girl in two consecutive days) and end up explaining over and over that my room included breakfast which they would then confirm from the manager and come back apologizing. no real spread of meal options, a bit too middle eastern in the choice of food available and they had three fire drills in the 6 days i spent there (alarm and all)! and the bathroom was so small, there was always bath water leaking on to the floor and the liquid soap (that doubled as a shampoo) never left me feeling clean enough so i had to go shopping for toileteries literally hours after i arrived. after the first two days however, everything went smoothly. my room was cleaned everyday by a constantly smiling nepalese guy and i never lost a thing (big deal cos i always had money strewn around the place from my shopping of the day before). So overall, asides the food and the breakfast bother, it was a good hotel for the amount of money i spent. actually very good.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Staff, Good Budget & Clean.”
Reviews.Author: Marwan1982
Reviews.Content: My view is Nice Staff, Good Budget & Clean. But I have some issues for the room (694) which I stayed. 1st Bad smell is coming from bathroom. 2nd The Hotel Electrician should check the light switch and the connection caz i cant switch all the room lights to switch only the bathroom. Also the 2 way light swtich for the room is not connecting properly. 3rd The Bed Base is moving front which making gap and always the pillow failing down in that gap. 4th The TV remote Battery shall be changed.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Abu Dhabi, Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates
Reviews.Title: “GOOD BUDGET HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: bhavinuae
Reviews.Content: Its really a worth to live at the very attractive location near to the main places to visit at dubai. The hotel is easily reachable by taxi or metro and it is very convinient to get taxi or metro from this hotel. very good restaurants and shopping malls are at the nearby places of this hotel. so, its worth to stay at this hotel. Though the room size is littel bit smaller, but it can be ok for the tourists who will just stay at night and go for outings all the day. Overall, its very economic hotel at the cream area of dubai.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: tanujraj
Reviews.Content: Nice location , check in was easy though no bell boy service is something which i didnt like , after all its a 3* hotel... we had two rooms rooms are smaller then stander size but a couple can manage , very clean n tidy. in our room no 734 from the second day the room started to stink once we use to return from outside. breakfast was very limited and almost same all 4 days, most of the dishes finish by 9 30 am and they don't refill. food at claypot was nice. over all a nice place with some things to improve

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience”
Reviews.Author: Abhinav555
Reviews.Content: The approachability of the hotel is the best of its kinds in Dubai. Everything required is on a walking distance from the hotel, all kinds of cabs/buses are easily available. The food at the hotel is a bliss plus the bar is very refreshing with exellent choice of liqor.

Reviews.Title: “Poor at best”
Reviews.Author: pvfc1981
Reviews.Content: Really bad service , ive stayed in worse looking hotels in poorer countries and had better service than we got here, the reception staff didn't seem to have a clue what they were doing and were not the friendliest either. we had 3 problems with the door card which they refused to believe was at fault and instead blamed us for not using correctly, until they finally came and saw for themselves. also got woke at 2 am to see if we had paid to stay for that night we had reception ring and a member of staff knock on the door and try to enter just to ask this...we had paid for the room months in advance and we had to be up at 4am that morning also to catch our flight.

Reviews.Title: “3 Star Luxury on a Budget”
Reviews.Author: asadjansari
Reviews.Content: One of the best properties in Dubai to stay in if you are on a budget. Although requires a cab every time you need to step out (nearest metro station is Sheikh Rashid Bin Khalid and Deira - Costs Dh10), it's centrally located. Most of the destinations are short hops if the traffic allows. Check-in is slower than most but you can't complain. Depends upon the number of people in front of you in the queue (yes, I have seen queues of tourists waiting to check-in). The hotel is huge with at least 600 rooms (as per my estimate.. Didn't count though). Rooms are small as per the industry standards but I stayed in a single room. However, the bed size was as good as a double bed that you may find in most of the hotels. Comfort levels are pretty high. No noise, no disturbances. The bed was amazingly comfortable and provided excellent sleep quality. Breakfast, although has a big menu, is usually the same everyday and same goes with the dinner buffet with one or two dishes changed here and there. But you can't complain. Food quality is good. The hotel also has a Sports bar & grill and a Chinese restaurant with again an excellent menu and food quality. The prices are set to be at a reasonable level and won't hurt your pocket too much. Didn't check out their Indian restaurant. Has a reasonable gym with a few treadmills and some other equipment and a small pool on the roof. Most amazing thing? They have a fast and reliable Internet connection in the rooms available for free for the hotel guests. The only thing that bugged me about it was it was an Ethernet connection and I have a Macbook Air. There was no free Wi-Fi. Had to trudge down to a Virgin store to buy myself an adapter. All in all, a pretty reasonable hotel worth staying in. Try and ignore the downsides which are really very few. They serve your daily stock of tea, sugar and milk and can provide fresh linen and towels whenever requested. Room service is prompt and staff's attitude is alright.

Reviews.Title: “lost cash in hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sanjeev Garg S
Reviews.Content: I stay city max bur Dubai for four nights 17/09/11 to 20/09/11, We are five friends, I book 3 rooms, I lost 500 usd and 500 AED from my room on 19/09/11, when this night we are all in one room. Rooms is good. But breakfast is not good.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: NeilMz
Reviews.Content: The hotel service is excellent and I felt complete value for money. Though buffent dinner may not be the ultimate choice, there are options from room service menu. The location may not be of great advantage as such. Hotel provides iron & board, mini bar, bath sleepers. So the stay is enjoyable

Reviews.Title: “not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: jaydeepj
Reviews.Content: Pros: good indian restaurants claypot as well as all day dining area. breakfast was ok. Cons: very conjusted rooms, no wardrobe!, no shower curtains causes water to spill out, bad toilet water spray, overall poor service. The advertisements such as free shuttle service are not provided.

Reviews.Title: “My stay at City Max - Bur Dubai”
Reviews.Author: vishal4488
Reviews.Content: Hey There, I stayed at City Max - Bur Dubai. It was small but very memorable stay at hotel. It is economy as well in the heart of the city. I have got very good dining / a bf. experince. Their staff is very helpful in every way that makes me forget that we are home away from home.. Really its been a good stay there. will definatly recommend to dubai visitors.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: ralph j j
Reviews.Content: Well to be candid, the hotel is simply unique,but for the arab woman at the reception who is very unfriendly and saucy.Minus her, the hotel is perfect. i enjoyed the free internet facility which is very okay for business travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and clean affordable hotel”
Reviews.Author: Carrubbistan
Reviews.Content: This new hotel came highly recommended from a friend and I was not disappointed. I've stayed on two trips now (3 nights total) and utilized their clean rooftop pool, high speed and reliable free (?) internet, and ate in one of the bars. While the food wasn't amazing, it was still good enough, and the place overall is great value for money. All the decore in the rooms is modern (ikea-esque) and very clean (don't need to worry about milddrew or musty smells here). If you don't mind a 5-10minute walk, the metro also runs by down the road, though there are always taxis outside waiting. Desk staff is friendly and during the hotter summer months the room was only $50 per night - a steal for this modern facility. I do recommend this to friends and continue to stay here each time I'm in Dubai.

Reviews.Title: “OK kind of”
Reviews.Author: Raj S
Reviews.Content: Rooms: Small Service: Self Service (not friendly for families with kids) Breakfast: Average. Cleanliness: Good Staff: Good Location: Great Value for Money

Reviews.Title: “Value for money, but needs improvement in lobby and booking handling”
Reviews.Author: ruthik
Reviews.Content: Good location, value for money. Booking executive was not well experienced, asked me to pay room charges again while checking in even though payment was made online, later refunded. Room service not offered for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Yum1
Reviews.Content: I know its taken me very long to review this hotel considering that we stayed there in Jan 2011. But I've got out my notes now and thought it worth writing something about the hotel. We arrived at the hotel at approx 14h00 after checking out of the Golden Sands Apartments and taking a taxi to Citymax Bur Dubai. Patrick at security assisted us with our luggage - smiling and helpful. On checking in, the person handling the check-in, despite me giving my details of the reservation, called up the reservation and advised me of the costs. They didn't check to see that this was already pre-paid accommodation that was done through a Tour operator, until I advised them of this. We then asked if someone could assist us in taking the luggage to the room but we were told that they cannot do this and we should make use of the trolleys (much like the ones at shopping malls!). This is the first time that I had see shopping trolleys at a hotel to take luggage to ones room! Patrick was the one that assisted us in taking the luggage to the room. Since the hotel is a fairly new hotel having opened not long before our arrive, the rooms were still new and linen etc in perfect condition and for the price that we paid - well worth it. There were no towels in the room, but after having phoned reception for some, they immediately had some sent up. We then set out for the day. On returning from our shopping expedition, we walked around in circles trying to find the hotel. Since its a new hotel, not too many people are aware of its location. Positive features - still a new hotel so decor etc is all still intact. Comfortable rooms but no more than 2 adults can be accommodated in the rooms. Rooms have satellite channels - quite a good variety. Breakfast was good and overall layout of the hotel is quite comfortable. Negative aspects - reception did not check that the reservation was already paid and I could have well ended up paying twice. They also did not give us messages that we received from my brother-in-law. Would hate to think that if it was something urgent what would have happenned. It was only when we called home, that we were told that he had left at least 3 messages with reception for us. All in all not a bad hotel but reception obviously needs some more training in getting messages to the guests as well as checking the reservations properly before asking for payment.

Reviews.Title: “good value for money”
Reviews.Author: vin6
Reviews.Content: stayed here for a week on a business trip. stayed on the 6th floor very quite and peaceful after a hard days work. The good - a newly built hotel, very clean and tidy, the bed is very comfortable. Every room has the same decor. For internet connection ask for the cable from reception as they dont have wifi, at times they might take a deposit for the internet cable. Roof top swimming pool which sports quite a view of Bur dubai and shiekh zayed road. Nice sports bar and an indian restaurant with live indian band who sing indian songs(poor guys they really work hard to keep the interest alive). Plenty of towels in the bathroom, The gym is well equipped, every room has a small fridge and an electronic safe. Self service of tea/coffee in every room unlimited supply. free parking. good lobby area, 24/7 cafe is also good. Inhouse sight seeing booking service available. staff and service - staff is very friendly, quick to response to every query, the towels and bedsheets are changed every day. Wake up call service is punctual. the bad - no one to help at times at the reception, very few bell boys. do not relay on rush laundry service or same day laundry service. tip - get a landmark shukran card beforehand (available throughout middle east) to get further discounts on rates for longer stay. basic travel guide - a 10 dhiram taxi ride to the nearest metro station or to burjuman which is quite a walking distance. From hotel to Dubai Mall/ burj khaleefa - 20 dhirams taxi ride one way.

Reviews.Title: “Handy location, great value for money, modern and spotless”
Reviews.Author: quanyindreaming
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on my own for 2 nights. Handy location and breakfast option available. Very clean. Rooms are small but I was only in it to sleep. Bathroom was functional. No WiFi unfortunately. Little supermarket about 20 meters away. Air-conditioned bus stop out the front.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel that suits your budget”
Reviews.Author: naseerm
Reviews.Content: This is a budget hotel with all facilities. Gives real value for money. Brand new and rooms are neat and clean. There are more than 600 rooms hence availability of rooms is easy Located in the heart of the city. They internet connection for residents is free which is a very useful facility for the residents. Because it is a budget hotel, there is no rooms service

Reviews.Title: “We will recomend this to others - Close to City & Metro Station”
Reviews.Author: bhaskar4u2u
Reviews.Content: Recently I traveled with my family to Dubai and we stayed at City Max hotel, many travel agencys tolda that City Max is newly opened and we really dont know about the service of the hotel they told not choose also. But finally i have chossen city max but it was really good brand new hotel. I recomend this hotel to everyone as it is very close to city and metro station. which is very important when ur traveling to Dubai. Dont miss the swimming pool which is located at terrace and from there you can see very nice city view. and breakfast was good . One good thing free internet facility in all the rooms. There is no room service, so you need to carry ur baggage.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Service and Location”
Reviews.Author: Shak1r
Reviews.Content: I travel to Dubai frequently, whether it be for Business or Leisure. I have stayed in many hotels and areas within Dubai. The CityMax Hotel is one of the best located and you will get great value for your money. I found the staff very helpful, especially the Manager Angelo Mendis who was very efficient and professional. In fact all the staff were very friendly, from the security guards (Iftikhar) to the bar staff (Faiza). This is also a great Hotel for sport. There was a great atmosphere in the Sport's bar during the Cricket World Cup matches and they show Premiership Football Matches etc on the big screen. The breakfast buffet is great and you must try the Indian Restaurant within the Hotel. There is also a decent gym and swimming pool located on the top floor. It really is located bang in the centre, so you will save money on taxis as all the major attractions (Mall of Emirates, Dubai Mall, bazaars, Marina) are not located that far from the Hotel. I stay in this hotel everytime I visit dubai now. Shakir (UK).

Reviews.Title: “Awesome stay”
Reviews.Author: Gulabani
Reviews.Content: The hotel is fully new developed and its one of the most successful running hotel in dubai... The hotel being one of the landmark group hotel itself tells about the service.. its located in the heart of the city from where there is easy access to jumeirah and easy access to bur dubai... If u like shopping u can have it all done in the city which is just a 20 min walk or a 5 min taxi ride..

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff & Clean Property”
Reviews.Author: virosh
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed with the staff and the service. The welcome was very good..and very quick. For a three star property i got a five star silver service. I had Break Fast @ all day dinning.. it lasted the whole day. Another good thing is they picked me up from the Air Por( Complimentary shuttle service). It was totally free of charge. Highly recomend this place.( i might be biased becuse of the ther service they provided me)

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel, good service n decent staff.....”
Reviews.Author: Rohit23
Reviews.Content: Citymax was our honeymoon hotel.and not even for a moment we regretted our decision of choosing citymax.absolutly comfortable with cordial staff and favorably located for tourists. We would surely recommend u to friends and family.

HotelInfo.Name: Citymax Bur Dubai
HotelInfo.Address: Kuwait St and Mankhool Rd, Al Mankhool | Bur Dubai, Dubai, United Arab Emirates
